title.rendered: Membership with Canadian Pharmacist Association – Get Licensed Now

content.rendered:
Applying to a PharmD program is the first-step towards becoming a licensed pharmacist in Canada. Pharmacy admission requirements for Waterloo University, About the program and How to apply as Future PharmD students

You are interested in studying Pharmacy at the University of Waterloo. You are welcome and I wish you take into consideration the following course requirement to gain admission.

Pharmacy admission requirements for Waterloo University

Contents

Who is A Pharmacist?.

Pharmacy admission requirements for International Baccalaureate (IB) students.

Program requirements.

About the program.

How to Apply for Future PharmD students.

How to Apply for CAPs.

The benefit of Studying Pharmacy through Canada’s only co-op pharmacy program.

Some notable Sample co-op positions.

Co-op work/study sequences.

What can you do with a pharmacy degree?

Career Prospects As a Pharmacist In Canada.

First thing first, who is a pharmacist?

Who is A Pharmacist?

A Pharmacist is a medication expert who identifies, resolves, and prevents medication-related problems for their patients. Many known pharmacists work in community pharmacies, but oftentimes they also provide care in hospitals, family health teams, and long-term care facilities, often collaborating closely with other health professionals.

Pharmacy admission requirements for International Baccalaureate (IB) students

Program requirements

  • To gain admission, candidates must successfully complete at least two full years of university science studies with Biology, Biomedical Sciences, and Honours Science
  • Minimum overall university average of 75%

Other requirements include;

  • CASPer test,
  • Pharmacy Admission Information Form,
  • letter of reference,
  • Interview, and
  • Fundamental Skills Assessment are required
  • High school students may qualify for Conditional Admission to Pharmacy

About the program

  • Available as a co-op program only
  • Requires previous university study
  • Graduate with a Doctor of Pharmacy degree (PharmD)
  • Offered by the School of Pharmacy
  • Biology, Biomedical Sciences, and Honours Science provide the fastest route into the Doctor of Pharmacy program

How to Apply for Future PharmD students

There are two ways to become a Science Student to qualify for admission into the PharmD program at the University of Waterloo.

  • CAP: Conditional Admission to Pharmacy (CAP) status,
  • PharmD Program method.

Normally, applications to the Pharmacy program are considered from university students who have completed at least two years of undergraduate science. By applying to – and receiving – CAP status at Waterloo, high school students receive a conditional offer of admission to begin the Pharmacy program after two years of studies at Waterloo.

How to Apply for CAPs

  1. Visit https://uwaterloo.ca/pharmacy/future-pharmd-students#academic-requirements
  2. Click on the CAPs button
  3. Follow all instructions as provided to complete the form application

See also >>> How to Apply Conditional Admission to Pharmacy (CAP)

The benefit of Studying Pharmacy through Canada’s only co-op pharmacy program | Licensed Pharmacist in Canada

Students gain paid work experience and can explore different areas and types of employers within the pharmaceutical industry.

Some notable Sample co-op positions

  • Pharmacy Assistant, Department of National Defence
  • Reconciliation Pharmacy Student, Guelph General Hospital
  • Pharmacist Student – Special Projects & Patient Care, St Joseph’s Health Care, London
  • Pharmacy Assistant, Costco
  • Special Projects Coordinator, Centre for Family Medicine

Co-op work/study sequences

  September to December January to April May to August
First-year – School School
Second-year School Co-op School
Third-year Co-op School Co-op
Fourth-year School School School
School = four-month school term, Co-op = four-month co-op work term
The Pharmacy program starts in January each year.

What can you do with a pharmacy degree?

Career Prospects As a Pharmacist In Canada

  • Clinical Consultant and Operations Pharmacist, Remedy’s RX Specialty Pharmacy
  • Clinical Pharmacist, St. Mary’s General Hospital
  • Drug Safety Associate, Actavis Canada
  • Pharmacist, Shoppers Drug Mart
  • General Surgery Pharmacist, Victoria Hospital
  • Pharmacist, Rexall Pharma Plus
  • Inpatient Pharmacist, Strathroy Middlesex General Hospital
  • Pharmaceutical Processor, McNeil Consumer Healthcare
  • Pharmacist, Parkwood Hospital

Did we help you with some information concerning Waterloo’s admission into the PharmD program? Like and share for more updates.
